fileContents..snapshotignore:
# .snapshotignore - Configure files and directories to ignore in snapshot system
# Syntax similar to .gitignore, supports glob pattern matching

# ===== Snapshot system files =====
.continue-reasoning/**
.snapshotignore         # Ignore .snapshotignore file itself

# ===== Temporary files and system files =====
*.log
*.tmp
.DS_Store
Thumbs.db

# ===== Build artifacts and dependencies =====
node_modules/**
dist/**
build/**
__pycache__/**
*.pyc
*.pyo

# ===== IDE and editor files =====
.vscode/**
.idea/**
*.swp
*.swo
*~

# ===== Runtime generated data files =====
# These files are usually generated by program execution and should not be tracked by snapshot system
*.json                  # Can be adjusted to more specific rules as needed
*.csv
*.xlsx
*_output.*
*_result.*
*_data.*

# ===== Cache files =====
.cache/**
*.cache

# ===== Version control systems =====
.git/**
.svn/**

# ===== Custom rules =====
# Add project-specific ignore rules here
# For example:
# my_project_outputs/**
# *.generated
fileContents.web_scraper_project/news_scraper.py:
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import json
import time
import random

HEADERS = {
    'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/58.0.3029.110 Safari/537.3'
}

URL = 'https://news.ycombinator.com/'
OUTPUT_FILE = 'news_headlines.json'


def fetch_headlines():
    try:
        response = requests.get(URL, headers=HEADERS)
        response.raise_for_status()
        soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser')

        headlines = []
        for item in soup.select('.athing')[:20]:
            title = item.select_one('.titlelink').get_text()
            link = item.select_one('.titlelink')['href']
            headlines.append({'title': title, 'link': link})

        with open(OUTPUT_FILE, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
            json.dump(headlines, f, ensure_ascii=False, indent=4)

    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        print(f"An error occurred: {e}")

    finally:
        time.sleep(random.uniform(1, 3))  # Random delay to prevent rate limiting

if __name__ == '__main__':
    fetch_headlines()
